title: @Riot Bard's Magical Journey in Twisted Treeline
body:
Hello there,

I have a question, Bard's E seems to have a limit of distance covered in TT.

Rather than asking if this is intended, or whether the bug will be fixed.

What I ask is, is it time consuming to have bard's E travel unlimited distances [ ~9000 distance units ] or not ?

( it would be really, really cool as a mechanic in a Featured Game Mode! )

Thank you in advance.

-_-

To clarify, Bard's E is not castable on certain angles of giant walls in Twisted Treeline.

Edit: included video, notice how the player does not create walls covering the longest distance available. That is because it is not possible, the range indicator disappears.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cmElxX00JZE

replies.body:
I bought bard as soon as he hit 6300, I tested him on the TT before any other mode. I didn't see any problems in the video for his portal.

What time in that video looks like it should of made it? 21 seconds in??

I believe you are confusing traveling through the portal as long as it's lined up with a solid wall for the distance, with the ability to teleport/gap close.

If you pay attention to the wall on the inside of the base and the wall on the outer that is next to the alter, there is a gap missing that is connected by chains.

Otherwise I don't understand the point you're making.

Second 3 and more, it'd be easier if you'd create a custom game and test bard in TT right now. Try to create the longest possible portal and you'll see what I mean. 

As for the "gap" you're talking about, you can actually cross the gap from your base towards the altar. Behind your nexus -> Altar.

This also shows on the topside wall of the Health Relic spawn, there are areas you can't create the portal on.
As someone who doesn't play Bard, pictures or a video would be really helpful here.
